messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]spirited & easy going
messages.msgSnippet: My youngest was drawing on herself a couple of weeks ago and told me it was for protection.  I just said oh, and now I leave her to her doodling.  There s no
messages.messageBody:
My youngest was drawing on herself a couple of weeks ago and
told me it was for protection. I just said 'oh,' and now I leave her
to her doodling. There's no way I'm going to mess with natural
talent.

Tracy

On 9 Jul 2000, at 9:03, NumoAstro@... wrote:

we are all born with this Nance, it's the "authority"
figures in our lives 
such as teachers, employers and unfortunately parents
in some instances that 
tell us "you don't see that, you don't hear that, you
don't know that, you 
don't feel that, you don't want that" and that beats
the ability to recognize 
our abilities out of us. Then we leave school and home
and we spend the next 
20 years getting that back.

Dawn F

messages.subject: RE:[Unschooling-dotcom]spirited & easy going
messages.msgSnippet: You re welcome.  sometimes I surprise myself  Tracy On 8 Jul 2000, at 20:20, Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall wrote:  Thank you Tracy, that was lovely. I lost
messages.messageBody:
You're welcome. sometimes I surprise myself <g>

Tracy

On 8 Jul 2000, at 20:20, Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall wrote:

Thank you Tracy, that was lovely. I lost a child when
I was a teen, and I was crying and sharing my grief
with a friend last year. She is a very spiritual
person and has reached a high level of psychic
development in our mututal religious path. She said to
me that she believed that my elder son was that child,
come back to me. He found his time to be born.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]spirited & easy going
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/8/2000 8:19:31 PM US Mountain Standard Time, tn-k4of5@idahopagan.com writes:  we are all born
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/8/2000 8:19:31 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
tn-k4of5@... writes:

<< a high level of psychic development >>

we are all born with this Nance, it's the "authority" figures in our lives
such as teachers, employers and unfortunately parents in some instances that
tell us "you don't see that, you don't hear that, you don't know that, you
don't feel that, you don't want that" and that beats the ability to recognize
our abilities out of us. Then we leave school and home and we spend the next
20 years getting that back.

Dawn F

messages.subject: RE:[Unschooling-dotcom]spirited & easy going
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thank you Tracy, that was lovely.  I lost a child when I was a teen, and I was crying and sharing my grief with a friend last year.  She is a very
messages.messageBody:
>Perhaps, then, Nanci, he chose you because you'd chosen to
>homeschool, and knew his spirit needed more space than school
>allows. If you believe you choose your life...
>
>Just a stray thought...
>Tracy

Thank you Tracy, that was lovely. I lost a child when I was a teen, and I was crying and sharing my grief with a friend last year. She is a very spiritual person and has reached a high level of psychic development in our mututal religious path. She said to me that she believed that my elder son was that child, come back to me. He found his time to be born.

Nanci K.
